name: Zubeen Garg
description:
'''Zubeen Garg''' (born '''Zubeen Borthakur''' {{IPA|as|zubin bɔɹtʰakuɹ}}; 18 November 1972) is an Indian singer–songwriter, composer, lyricist, music director, music producer, actor, film director, film producer, screenwriter, poet and philanthropist. He primarily works for and sings in the [[Assamese language|Assamese]], [[Bengali language|Bengali]] and [[Hindi]]-language film and music industries, but has sung in 40 other languages and [[dialect]]s, including [[Bishnupriya Manipuri language|Bishnupriya Manipuri]], [[Adi languages|Adi]], [[Boro language (India)|Boro]], [[English language|English]], [[Goalpariya dialects|Goalpariya]], [[Kannada]], [[Karbi language|Karbi]], [[Khasi language|Khasi]], [[Malayalam]], [[Marathi language|Marathi]], [[Mising language|Mising]], [[Nepali language|Nepali]], [[Odia language|Odia]], [[Sanskrit]], [[Sindhi language|Sindhi]], [[Tamil language|Tamil]], [[Telugu language|Telugu]], [[Tiwa language (India)|Tiwa]]. He is also a [[multi-instrumentalist]] and plays 12 instruments including [[anandalahari]], [[dhol]], [[dotara]], [[drum]]s, [[guitar]], [[harmonica]], [[Pump organ|harmonium]], [[mandolin]], [[Electronic keyboard|keyboard]], [[tabla]] and various [[percussion instrument]]s. He is Assam's highest-paid singer.

In 2011, Zubeen Garg was honoured as a guest artist of the year by the Assam Convention, at [[Oak Brook, Illinois|Oakbrook]] in [[Chicago]], [[United States]].
